description: This fixes a number of units issues in ``AbsorptionSpectrum`` and makes the Voigt profile generator fully unit aware.
title: Fixing unit support in AbsorptionSpectrum

content.html: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://hub.yt:8080/job/yt_testsuite_dev/82/

content.raw: Ooops, emacs tabbing messed me up after I uncommented it.
content.html: Ooops, emacs tabbing messed me up after I uncommented it.

content.raw: I think you can just remove the amu_cgs and just use the `convert_to_units('g')` here.
content.html: I think you can just remove the amu_cgs and just use the convert_to_units('g') here.

content.raw: Similarly, I think you can make atomic_mass a `YTQuantity()` in `amu` units.
content.html: Similarly, I think you can make atomic_mass a YTQuantity() in amu units.

content.raw: Excellent idea.
content.html: Excellent idea.

content.raw: Couldn't this happen inside `generate_total_fit`?
content.html: Couldn't this happen inside generate_total_fit?

content.raw: I'm not very knowledgable on the spectrum fitting code and didn't really want to mess with it right now.  This seemed like the easiest thing to get things working.
content.html: I'm not very knowledgable on the spectrum fitting code and didn't really want to mess with it right now. This seemed like the easiest thing to get things working.

content.raw:
It may fix the tests, but in my opinion changing a cookbook recipe is equivalent to an API break.

Something like

```
if isinstance(wavelength, YTArray):
    wavelength = wavelength.d
```

inside `generate_total_fit` means that people won't need to update their scripts.
content.html:
It may fix the tests, but in my opinion changing a cookbook recipe is equivalent to an API break.

Something like

if isinstance(wavelength, YTArray):
    wavelength = wavelength.d

inside generate_total_fit means that people won't need to update their scripts.

content.raw: All tests pass. Good job!
content.html: All tests pass. Good job!

content.raw: Do we want to revisit this question?
content.html: Do we want to revisit this question?

content.raw: I was torn.  You guys at the hangout decide.
content.html: I was torn. You guys at the hangout decide.

content.raw: @ngoldbaum?
content.html: Nathan Goldbaum?

content.raw: What's the issue with the two-line change in `generate_total_fit`?  Another way to think about this: this is the sort of input validation issue that optimally a user should never have to think about.
content.html: What's the issue with the two-line change in generate_total_fit? Another way to think about this: this is the sort of input validation issue that optimally a user should never have to think about.

content.raw: Ok, I'm convinced.  Will update.
content.html: Ok, I'm convinced. Will update.

content.raw: When the tests pass again, I'll merge.
content.html: When the tests pass again, I'll merge.
